patterns: Should I get a Chromebook or a laptop?
Why does my Wi-Fi signal keep dropping in my home?
Why does my laptop turn off when I unplug it?
responses: Technically, a Chromebook is a laptop (a portable computer you can use on your lap). If you're planning on getting a new laptop, you have three primary choices:1.Chromebook 2.Windows laptop 3.Apple laptop

If your laptop is having trouble maintaining a Wi-Fi connection in your home, it's often due to signal interference. The two most common causes of interference are physical barriers that block or degrade the signal, and interference from other wireless signals.

If your laptop turns off immediately when you unplug it from a power source, it means your battery is not working. Most likely, your battery reached the end of its useful life and stopped holding a charge.for more information you can contact our engineer
